akn:section.akn:heading: Admissibility in evidence of eye witness testimony

akn:content.akn:p: § 3502. Admissibility in evidence of eye witness testimony The testimony of a witness that he saw the accused commit or participate in the commission of the crime for which the accused is being tried shall be admissible in evidence in a criminal prosecution in any trial court ordained and established under article III of the Constitution of the United States. (Added Pub. L. 90–351, title II, § 701(a), June 19, 1968, 82 Stat. 211.)
